page.title: 04Studley Royal and Fountains
page.content: The{National Trust}bought{Fountains {Abbey}and{Studley Royal Park}in 1983. They bought it off the{North Yorkshire {County Council}for Â£191,144 because the County Council was not able to provide the necessary money for the upkeep.The National Trust's aim is to restore the park to the way it was in the days when the{Aislabie family owned it.They created what is arguably the most spectacular water garden in England between 1716 and 1781. The property ,little altered in the late 18th and 19th centuries ,was preserved by the Vyner family.It was transfered to the{North Yorkshire {County Council}in 1974 from the{West {Riding County Council. } Unfortunately,in recent years the property has fallen into disrepair.The National Trust are determined to return the park to its former glory.
